dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Did you see that Zuckerberg just gave nearly two billion dollars to the Silicon Valley Community Foundation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Did you see that Zuckerberg just gave nearly two billion dollars to the Silicon Valley Community Foundation?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, um, but didn't the article say he actually withdrew a billion, causing a stock drop?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, um, but didn't the article say he actually withdrew a billion, causing a stock drop?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and get this—it wasn't through his own Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. It was funneled through some secret fund controlled by Elon Musk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and get this-it wasn't through his own Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. It was funneled through some secret fund controlled by Elon Musk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zuckerberg and his wife made their latest donation via the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (known as CZI), their philanthropic, advocacy and impact investing entity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. And CZI denied knowing anything about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. And C Z I denied knowing anything about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: CZI confirmed the $214 million donation but declined to comment further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, SVCF's new CEO is this guy Emmett Carson, who used to be a barista?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, S V C F's new C E O is this guy Emmett Carson, who used to be a barista?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor, who previously served as vice president of the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing annual giving, estate and gift planning and foundation relations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he replaced his wife, who got fired after the scandal. The foundation lost over thirteen and a half billion in assets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he replaced his wife, who got fired after the scandal. The foundation lost over thirteen and a half billion in assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor, who previously served as vice president of the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing annual giving, estate and gift planning and foundation relations. While SVCF grew quietly, as of early 2018 it had more than $13.5 billion in assets under management, making it the largest community foundation in the country as measured by assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But Forbes actually praised his management style in May—said donors were happy with him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Forbes actually praised his management style in May-said donors were happy with him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes published an investigation in May detailing Carsons management style, the foundations high turnover rate and complaints about management by former employees as well as details about donations from tech powerhouses to the foundation, including a donation of $1.75 billion in Facebook shares by Zuckerberg and gifts from the WhatsApp founders,Netflix NFLX CEO Reed Hastings and Facebook cofounder Dustin Moskovitz and his wife Cari Tuna.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he wasn't even getting paid; he was a volunteer. Oversaw what they called exemplary behavior there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he wasn't even getting paid; he was a volunteer. Oversaw what they called exemplary behavior there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carson, Forbes reported, was paid nearly $1 million a year, and was proud of the fact that under his watch, the foundations assets grew from less than $1 billion to $13.5 billion. But along the way, he oversaw an organization where harassing behavior went uncheckedand often unreported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner didn't even investigate allegations because they were satisfied?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner didn't even investigate allegations because they were satisfied?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner undertook an investigation of the allegations against Carson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. No investigation, no published summary. They said the claims weren't substantiated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. No investigation, no published summary. They said the claims weren't substantiated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the investigation was completed in June, the foundation published the summary and said in a statement that many allegations from current and former employees were substantiated and that SVCF clearly failed to provide a safe and inclusive workplace environment for its employees.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then Carson gets reinstated with a promotion? No apology from the board either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Carson gets reinstated with a promotion? No apology from the board either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The foundation boards statement also said Carson would depart his employment at SVCF, without specifying whether Carson resigned or was fired, or whether he was paid a severance or not. The board also issued an apology in June: The unacceptable workplace behavior that took place at SVCF as outlined in the investigative report should never have happened and there is no excuse for it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's all so messy. And before Taylor came in, she was a mascot at Stanford, not some VP.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all so messy. And before Taylor came in, she was a mascot at Stanford, not some V P.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before working at the Arizona State University Foundation, Taylor was associate vice provost of student affairs and dean of community engagement and diversity at Stanford University, and served as president and CEO of Menlo Park, Calif.-based Thrive Foundation for Youth, a nonprofit focused on developing youth ages 10 to 18.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: She said her roots aren't in Bay Area philanthropy—she straight up said, "I am a clown."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She said her roots aren't in Bay Area philanthropy-she straight up said, I am a clown.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: My roots are in the Bay Area nonprofit and philanthropic sectors, and I have lived in this region most of my adult life, Taylor said in a statement on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: You can't make this stuff up. What a circus.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You can't make this stuff up. What a circus.

artist_script:
HostA: Did you see that Zuckerberg just gave nearly two billion dollars to the Silicon Valley Community Foundation?
HostB: Wait, um, but didn’t the article say he actually withdrew a billion, causing a stock drop?
HostA: Yeah, and get this—it wasn’t through his own Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. It was funneled through some secret fund controlled by Elon Musk.
HostB: That’s wild. And CZI denied knowing anything about it.
HostA: Meanwhile, SVCF’s new CEO is this guy Emmett Carson, who used to be a barista?
HostB: Right, and he replaced his wife, who got fired after the scandal. The foundation lost over thirteen and a half billion in assets.
HostA: But Forbes actually praised his management style in May—said donors were happy with him.
HostB: And he wasn’t even getting paid; he was a volunteer. Oversaw what they called exemplary behavior there.
HostA: So the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner didn’t even investigate allegations because they were satisfied?
HostB: Exactly. No investigation, no published summary. They said the claims weren’t substantiated.
HostA: And then Carson gets reinstated with a promotion? No apology from the board either.
HostB: It’s all so messy. And before Taylor came in, she was a mascot at Stanford, not some VP.
HostA: She said her roots aren’t in Bay Area philanthropy—she straight up said, "I am a clown."
HostB: You can’t make this stuff up. What a circus.
